jparsec.graph

Class CreateSurface3D

  • java.lang.Object
    • jparsec.graph.CreateSurface3D
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class CreateSurface3D
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Creates a surface plot using the SurfacePlotter library by Eric Aro and Yanto Suryono. A surface plot can be rotated, zoomed, and resized with the mouse. F2 key allows to show/hide a panel with more options. Ctrl + mouse can be used to pan the surface.
    Author:
    eric, T. Alonso Albi - OAN (Spain)
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Creates a surface from a grid chart object.

      Creates a surface from two grid chart objects.
      CreateSurface3D(java.lang.String f, double[] lim, java.lang.String xLabel, java.lang.String yLabel, java.lang.String zLabel, GridChartElement.COLOR_MODEL colorModel)
      Creates a surface plot from a function.
      CreateSurface3D(java.lang.String f1, java.lang.String f2, double[] lim, java.lang.String xLabel, java.lang.String yLabel, java.lang.String zLabel, GridChartElement.COLOR_MODEL colorModel)
      Creates a surface plot with two functions.

    • Constructor Detail

      • CreateSurface3D

        public CreateSurface3D(GridChartElement grid)
        Creates a surface from a grid chart object. Note certain properties of the object are not supported in this class, like pointers, subtitles, or the properties for the levels.
        Parameters:
        grid - The grid Object.

      • CreateSurface3D

        public CreateSurface3D(GridChartElement grid1,
               GridChartElement grid2)
        Creates a surface from two grid chart objects. Note certain properties of the objects are not supported in this class, like pointers, subtitles, or the properties for the levels.
        Parameters:
        grid1 - The first grid Object.
        grid2 - The second grid Object.

      • CreateSurface3D

        public CreateSurface3D(java.lang.String f,
               double[] lim,
               java.lang.String xLabel,
               java.lang.String yLabel,
               java.lang.String zLabel,
               GridChartElement.COLOR_MODEL colorModel)
        Creates a surface plot from a function. The plot is restricted to the input limits.
        Parameters:
        f - The function f(x, y) in Java notation.
        lim - Limits of the plot: minimum x, maximum x, minimum y, and maximum y.
        xLabel - the label for x axis.
        yLabel - the label for y axis.
        zLabel - the label for z axis.
        colorModel - The color model.

      • CreateSurface3D

        public CreateSurface3D(java.lang.String f1,
               java.lang.String f2,
               double[] lim,
               java.lang.String xLabel,
               java.lang.String yLabel,
               java.lang.String zLabel,
               GridChartElement.COLOR_MODEL colorModel)
        Creates a surface plot with two functions. The plot is restricted to the input limits.
        Parameters:
        f1 - The first function f(x, y) in Java notation.
        f2 - The second function f(x, y) in Java notation. Can be null.
        lim - Limits of the plot: minimum x, maximum x, minimum y, and maximum y.
        xLabel - the label for x axis.
        yLabel - the label for y axis.
        zLabel - the label for z axis.
        colorModel - The color model.

        public java.lang.String[] getFunctions()
        Returns the function/s used for the surface/s.
        Returns:

      • getLimits

        public double[] getLimits()
        Returns the limits of the visual area for a surface defined by a function.
        Returns:
        The limits (minimum x, maximum x, minimum y, maximum y), or null if the limits are inside the grid chart object.
